intro: Odontostemma weissianum var. bifidum, commonly known as the bifid odontostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive bifid (split) leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
